content:
Deleting or renaming popstate.dat should force a download of all messages.

http://kb.mozillazine.org/Popstate.dat

Rebuilding the sqlite file only resets the global search database in case search results are incorrect.

content: Gmail doesn't work like a normal POP server would. Messages are marked as already downloaded at the server. If you want already downloaded messages to be downloaded again, you have to use webmail and make that happen in Gmail Settings > Forwarding and POP/IMAP.

content:
This is IMAP or POP?

The main problem at the root of not receiving emails is Third Party Anti-Virus software. I'd suggest that, if you have any installed (especially Norton or Bitdefender), you switch off Email protection temporarily and see if it's magically resolved.

You could start Windows in Safe Mode with Networking but that would be pretty much the same reason for switching off Email Protection.

Apart from that, I don't have a solution for you. Please respond so that this question goes back into the list of problems that need resolving.
creator: frisée

content:
Does the user name/email address in the 'From' section of your email (1) match the User name in your SMTP Settings (2) and the email address in your Server Settings (3)?

1 - Hamburger (top right)/Account Settings - click on the name of the account through which you are sending the email. On the right is the return email address called 'Email Address' unless you have put another email address in 'Reply-to Address'.

2 - Hamburger (top right)/Account Settings/Outgoing Server (SMTP). Highlight the server through which you are sending the email and the User Name is displayed at the bottom. It can be changed using the 'Edit' button.

3 - Hamburger (top right)/Account Settings - click on the 'Server Settings' under the account through which you are sending the email. The email address is in the 'User Name' field.

It's not unusual for an Email provider to change the servers - so doing that with the latest release of their details is worth doing.
creator: frisée

content: I have checked, and the name for his SMTP account is mine, because I'm the one who has the account. If I put his name instead, I dont get my messages any more. What is strange is that he gets his mails. It's only sending the problem.
creator: ruaud.isa

content:
ruaud.isa said
I have checked, and the name for his SMTP account is mine, because I'm the one who has the account. If I put his name instead, I dont get my messages any more. What is strange is that he gets his mails. It's only sending the problem.

How many SMTP entries do you have? Only one? You should have a distinctive SMTP Server for each account - the return email address must match the log in details or the servers can reject the traffic.
creator: frisée

content:
As soon as you said 'elderly friend', I felt the hairs on the back of my neck stand up. I look over a couple of elderly people's computers and, amongst other things, the amount of times they click-drag folders and files across their email accounts is frightening - with consequences that have me frequently baffled.

I'm not sure I'll be able to help but there have been a couple of posts recently where people have complained that functionality has been compromised - and it's become apparent a few posts in that the file structure is something worthy of a horror movie plot.

Before someone could help, I think we need a screenshots of the file structure (with any personal info like email addresses) removed. Is this an IMAP or POP account? How many of each? Thunderbird is on a computer?? Which version of Thunderbird are you using? Which Operating System are you using?

We can manually delete some folders on the HD but it really needs to be seen what the extent of the problem is first.
creator: frisée

content:
The main problem with the retrieval and sending of email is the interference from Third Party Software. If you're running it, please suspend Email Scanning and see if the matter is resolved. If it is, you'll need to decide which way to go with Third Party Software.

.oOo.

Le principal problème lié à la récupération et à l'envoi d'e-mails est l'interférence d'un logiciel tiers. Si vous l'exécutez, veuillez suspendre l'analyse des e-mails et voir si le problème est résolu. Si c'est le cas, vous devrez décider de la marche à suivre avec un logiciel tiers.
creator: frisée

content: There is a universal setting not to download remote content in emails (Hamburger icon (top right)/Settings/Search for 'Mail Content') but, if the images are attached to or embedded in the email (any email), they'll arrive with the email.
